com.github.jukkakarvanen.kafka.streams.test

Class TestOutputTopic<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.jukkakarvanen.kafka.streams.test.TestOutputTopic<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of the Kafka key
    V - the type of the Kafka value

    public class TestOutputTopic<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
    TestOutputTopic is used to read records from topic in TopologyTestDriver. To use TestOutputTopic create new class TopologyTestDriver.createOutputTopic(String, Deserializer, Deserializer) In actual test code, you can read message values, keys, KeyValue or TestRecord You need to have own TestOutputTopic for each topic.

    If you need to test key, value and headers, use readRecord() methods. Using readKeyValue() you get directly KeyValue, but have no access to headers any more Using readValue() you get directly value, but have no access to key or headers any more

    Processing messages

    
     private TestOutputTopic<String, Long> outputTopic;
      ...
     outputTopic = testDriver.createOutputTopic(OUTPUT_TOPIC, stringDeserializer, longDeserializer);
     ...
     assertThat(outputTopic.readValue()).isEqual(1);
    See Also:
    TopologyTestDriver

        public V readValue()
        Read one Record from output topic and return value only.

        Note. The key and header is not available

        Returns:
        Next value for output topic
